intro: Julocroton stipularis, commonly known as the stipular croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and vibrant, yellow-orange flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
